00026 LblListElm *lbllist_add(LblListElm *head, REG ptr, char *name, size_t len)
00027 {
00028     LblListElm *newhead = malloc(sizeof(*newhead));
00029 
00030     newhead->next = head;
00031     newhead->pointer = ptr;
00032     newhead->name = malloc(len + 1);
00033     strncpy(newhead->name, name, len);
00034 
00035     return newhead;
00036 }

00042 LblListElm *lbllist_next(LblListElm *current)
00043 {
00044     return current->next;
00045 }
00046 
00054 bool lbllist_get(LblListElm *head, char *name, size_t len, REG *pointer)
00055 {
00056     for(LblListElm* lbl = head; lbl; lbl = lbllist_next(lbl))
00057     {
00058         if(!strncmp(lbl->name, name, len))
00059         {
00060             *pointer = lbl->pointer;
00061             return true;
00062         }
00063     }
00064 
00065     return false;
00066 }

00089 typedef enum {
00090     PM_REG,     // RX
00091     PM_IMM,     // #X
00092     PM_IND,     // [RX]
00093     PM_DIR,     // [X]
00094     //PM_DEP    // X[RY]   //TODO

00105 mode pseudomode_to_mode(PMode spmode, PMode dpmode)
00106 {
00107     switch(dpmode)
00108     {
00109     case PM_REG:
00110         switch(spmode)
00111         {
00112         case PM_REG:
00113             return REGREG;
00114         case PM_IMM:
00115             return REGIMM;
00116         case PM_DIR:
00117             return REGDIR;
00118         case PM_IND:
00119             return REGIND;
00120         default:
00121             return REGISTER;
00122         }
00123         break;
00124     case PM_IND:
00125         switch(spmode)
00126         {
00127         case PM_REG:
00128             return INDREG;
00129         case PM_IMM:
00130             return INDIMM;
00131         default:
00132             return INDIRECT;
00133         }
00134         break;
00135     case PM_IMM:
00136         return IMMEDIATE;
00137     case PM_DIR:
00138         switch(spmode)
00139         {
00140         case PM_REG:
00141             return DIRREG;
00142         case PM_IMM:
00143             return DIRIMM;
00144         default:
00145             return DIRECT;
00146         }
00147         break;
00148     }
00149     return REGISTER;
00150 }

00152 bool sivm_parse_file(int* memsize, cmd_word *mem[], char *file)
00153 {
00154     bool ret;
00155     int size;
00156     FILE* f = fopen(file, "r");
00157     if(f == NULL) {
00158         perror("fopen");
00159         return false;
00160     }
00161     fseek(f, 0, SEEK_END);
00162     size = ftell(f);
00163     rewind(f);
00164     
00165     char buffer[size + sizeof('\0')];
00166 
00167     fread(buffer, size + sizeof('\0'), 1, f);
00168     buffer[size] = '\0';
00169     ret = sivm_parse(memsize, mem, buffer);
00170     fclose(f);
00171 
00172     return ret;
00173 }

00175 bool iswhitespace(char c)
00176 {
00177     return c == ' ' || c == '\t';
00178 }
00179 
00180 int ascii2base(char ascii, int base)
00181 {
00182     switch(base)
00183     {
00184     case 16:
00185         if((ascii >= 'a' && ascii <= 'f') || (ascii >= 'A' && ascii <= 'F'))
00186             return tolower(ascii) - 'a';
00187     case 2:
00188     case 10:
00189         return ascii - '0';
00190         break;
00191     default:
00192         return 0;
00193     }
00194 }
00195 
00202 bool parse_number(Parser* parser, int* value, bool modifiable)
00203 {
00204     int base = 10;
00205 
00206     // should here be expecting a number (even a register number)
00207     if(!isdigit(*parser->cur))
00208     {
00209         if(modifiable)
00210         {
00211             if(*parser->cur == 'b' &&
00212                (*(parser->cur+1) == '0' || *(parser->cur+1) == '1'))
00213             {
00214                 base = 2;
00215             }
00216             else
00217             {
00218                 REG reg;
00219                 if(lbllist_get(parser->labels, parser->cur,
00220                                strlen(parser->cur) - 1, &reg))
00221                 {
00222                     *value = reg;
00223                     return true;
00224                 }
00225             }
00226         }
00227         else
00228         {
00229             fprintf(stderr, "Unexpected token at %d:%d : `%c'\n",
00230                     parser->row, parser->col, *parser->cur);
00231             return false;
00232         }
00233     }
00234     
00235     if(*parser->cur == '0' && *(parser->cur + 1) == 'x')
00236         base = 16;
00237     
00238     *value = 0;
00239     
00240     // read the number
00241     for(; *parser->cur && isdigit(*parser->cur); parser->col++,parser->cur++)
00242     {
00243         *value = *value * base + ascii2base(*parser->cur, base);
00244     }
00245 
00246     return value;
00247 }
00248 
00256 bool parse_attrib(Parser *parser, PMode *pmode, int *data, int *reg)
00257 {
00258     bool ispointer = false,
00259          isregister = false,
00260          isimmediate = false;
00261     int n;
00262     
00263     // skipy
00264     for(; iswhitespace(*parser->cur); parser->cur++,parser->col++)
00265     {}
00266     
00267     // indirect and direct mode are specified by [ ]
00268     if(*parser->cur == '[')
00269     {
00270         ispointer = true;
00271         parser->col++;
00272         parser->cur++;
00273     }
00274     
00275     // immediat mode is specified by precessing the number by #
00276     if(*parser->cur == '#' && ispointer == false)
00277     {
00278         isimmediate = true;
00279         parser->col++;
00280         parser->cur++;
00281     }
00282     
00283     if(isalpha(*parser->cur))
00284     {
00285         // it is a bird, is it a plane ? no, it's a register
00286         if((*parser->cur == 'R' || *parser->cur == 'r') &&
00287            isdigit(*(parser->cur+1)))
00288         {
00289             isregister = true;
00290             parser->col++;
00291             parser->cur++;
00292         }
00293     }
00294     
00295     // read the number
00296     if(!parse_number(parser, &n, !isregister))
00297     {
00298         fprintf(stderr, "Unexpected token at %d:%d : `%c'\n",
00299                 parser->row, parser->col, *parser->cur);
00300         return false;
00301     }
00302 
00303     // now guess the mode
00304     if(isregister)
00305     {
00306         *reg = n;
00307         if(ispointer)
00308             *pmode = PM_IND;
00309         else
00310             *pmode = PM_REG;
00311     }
00312     else
00313     {
00314         *data = n;
00315         if(ispointer)
00316             *pmode = PM_DIR;
00317         else
00318             *pmode = PM_IMM;
00319     }
00320     
00321     // indrect and direct mode are closed by ']'
00322     if(ispointer)
00323     {
00324         for(; iswhitespace(*parser->cur); parser->cur++,parser->col++)
00325         {}
00326 
00327         if(*parser->cur != ']')
00328         {
00329             fprintf(stderr, "Unexpected token at %d:%d : `%c'\n",
00330                     parser->row, parser->col, *parser->cur);
00331             return false;
00332         }
00333     }
00334 
00335     return true;
00336 }
00337 
00338 bool parse_1attrib(Parser* parser, cmd_word m[3], unsigned int *instrsize)
00339 {
00340     // source
00341     int sdata, sreg;
00342     PMode spmode;
00343 
00344     // assert there is at least one whitespace before
00345     if(!iswhitespace(*parser->cur))
00346     {
00347         fprintf(stderr, "Unexpected token at %d:%d : `%c'\n",
00348                 parser->row, parser->col, *parser->cur);
00349         exit(1);
00350     }
00351 
00352     // read the source
00353     if(!parse_attrib(parser, &spmode, &sdata, &sreg))
00354     {
00355         fprintf(stderr, "parse_attrib returned false\n");
00356         return false;
00357     }
00358     if(spmode == PM_REG || spmode == PM_IND)
00359         m[0].codage.source = sreg;
00360     if(spmode == PM_IMM || spmode == PM_DIR)
00361         m[(*instrsize)++].brut = sdata;
00362 
00363     for(; iswhitespace(*parser->cur);
00364         parser->col++,parser->cur++)
00365     {}
00366 
00367     switch(spmode)
00368     {
00369     case PM_REG:
00370         m[0].codage.mode = REGISTER;
00371         break;
00372     case PM_IMM:
00373         m[0].codage.mode = IMMEDIATE;
00374         break;
00375     case PM_DIR:
00376         m[0].codage.mode = DIRECT;
00377         break;
00378     case PM_IND:
00379         m[0].codage.mode = INDIRECT;
00380         break;
00381     }
00382 
00383     return true;
00384 }
00385 
00386 bool parse_2attribs(Parser* parser, cmd_word m[3], unsigned int *instrsize)
00387 {
00388     // source
00389     int sdata, sreg;
00390     PMode spmode;
00391 
00392     // destination
00393     int ddata, dreg;
00394     PMode dpmode;
00395 
00396     // assert there is at least one whitespace before
00397     if(!iswhitespace(*parser->cur))
00398     {
00399         fprintf(stderr, "Unexpected token at %d:%d : `%c'\n",
00400                 parser->row, parser->col, *parser->cur);
00401         exit(1);
00402     }
00403 
00404     // read the destination
00405     if(!parse_attrib(parser, &dpmode, &ddata, &dreg))
00406     {
00407         fprintf(stderr, "parse_attrib return false\n");
00408         return false;
00409     }
00410     if(dpmode == PM_REG || dpmode == PM_IND)
00411         m[0].codage.dest = dreg;
00412     if(dpmode == PM_IMM || dpmode == PM_DIR)
00413         m[(*instrsize)++].brut = ddata;
00414     
00415     // assert there is a coma beteen source and destination
00416     if (*parser->cur == ',')
00417     {
00418         parser->cur++;
00419         parser->col++;
00420     }
00421     else
00422     {
00423         fprintf(stderr, "Unexpected token at %d:%d : `%c'\n",
00424                 parser->row, parser->col, *parser->cur);
00425         exit(1);
00426     }
00427 
00428     for(; iswhitespace(*parser->cur);
00429         parser->col++,parser->cur++)
00430     {}
00431 
00432     // read the source
00433     if(!parse_attrib(parser, &spmode, &sdata, &sreg))
00434     {
00435         return false;
00436         fprintf(stderr, "parse_attrib return false\n");
00437     }
00438     if(spmode == PM_REG || spmode == PM_IND)
00439         m[0].codage.source = sreg;
00440     if(spmode == PM_IMM || spmode == PM_DIR)
00441         m[(*instrsize)++].brut = sdata;
00442 
00443     for(; iswhitespace(*parser->cur);
00444         parser->col++,parser->cur++)
00445     {}
00446 
00447     m[0].codage.mode = pseudomode_to_mode(spmode, dpmode);
00448 
00449     return true;
00450 }
00451 
00452 bool parse_pass_line(Parser* parser, char *line)
00453 {
00454     char instr[256];
00455     cmd_word m[3];
00456     unsigned int instrsize;
00457 
00458     parser->cur = line;
00459     parser->col = 1;
00460 
00461     // skipy
00462     for(; iswhitespace(*parser->cur);
00463         parser->col++, parser->cur++)
00464     {}
00465 
00466     // read the instructions name
00467     if(sscanf(parser->cur, "%s", instr) == 1)
00468     {
00469         int len = strlen(instr);
00470     
00471         // in case there is a label just before some code on a the same line
00472         if(instr[len - 1] == ':')
00473         {
00474             parser->cur += len;
00475             parser->col += len;
00476 
00477             return parse_pass_line(parser, parser->cur);
00478         }
00479 
00480         instrsize = 1;
00481         parser->cur += len;
00482         parser->col += len;
00483 
00484         // load SOURCE, DEST
00485         if(!strcmp(instr, "load"))
00486         {
00487             m[0].codage.codeop = LOAD;
00488             if(!parse_2attribs(parser, m, &instrsize))
00489                 return false;
00490         }
00491         // store SOURCE, DEST
00492         else if(!strcmp(instr, "store"))
00493         {
00494             m[0].codage.codeop = STORE;
00495             if(!parse_2attribs(parser, m, &instrsize))
00496                 return false;
00497         }
00498         // add SOURCE, DEST
00499         else if(!strcmp(instr, "add"))
00500         {
00501             m[0].codage.codeop = ADD;
00502             if(!parse_2attribs(parser, m, &instrsize))
00503                 return false;
00504         }
00505         // sub SOURCE, DEST
00506         else if(!strcmp(instr, "sub"))
00507         {
00508             m[0].codage.codeop = SUB;
00509             if(!parse_2attribs(parser, m, &instrsize))
00510                 return false;
00511         }
00512         // jmp SOURCE
00513         else if(!strcmp(instr, "jmp"))
00514         {
00515             m[0].codage.codeop = JMP;
00516             if(!parse_1attrib(parser, m, &instrsize))
00517                 return false;
00518         }
00519         // jeq SOURCE
00520         else if(!strcmp(instr, "jeq"))
00521         {
00522             m[0].codage.codeop = JEQ;
00523             if(!parse_1attrib(parser, m, &instrsize))
00524                 return false;
00525         }
00526         // call SOURCE
00527         else if(!strcmp(instr, "call"))
00528         {
00529             m[0].codage.codeop = CALL;
00530             if(!parse_1attrib(parser, m, &instrsize))
00531                 return false;
00532         }
00533         // ret
00534         else if(!strcmp(instr, "ret"))
00535         {
00536             m[0].codage.codeop = RET;
00537         }
00538         // push SOURCE
00539         else if(!strcmp(instr, "push"))
00540         {
00541             m[0].codage.codeop = PUSH;
00542             if(!parse_1attrib(parser, m, &instrsize))
00543                 return false;
00544         }
00545         // pop DEST
00546         else if(!strcmp(instr, "pop"))
00547         {
00548             m[0].codage.codeop = POP;
00549             if(!parse_1attrib(parser, m, &instrsize))
00550                 return false;
00551         }
00552         // halt
00553         else if(!strcmp(instr, "halt"))
00554         {
00555             m[0].codage.codeop = HALT;
00556         }
00557         else
00558         {
00559             instrsize = 0;
00560         }
00561         
00562         // write instruction into the memory
00563         if(instrsize > 0)
00564         {
00565             if(parser->mem)
00566             {
00567                 if(!checkModes(m[0]))
00568                 {
00569                     fprintf(stderr,
00570                             "Unknown modes for instruction at line %d\n",
00571                             parser->row);
00572                     // return false;
00573                 }
00574                 
00575                 // second pass
00576                 for(int i = 0; i < instrsize; i++)
00577                     parser->mem[parser->pc++].brut = m[i].brut;
00578             }
00579             else
00580             {
00581                 // first pass
00582                 parser->pc += instrsize;
00583             }
00584         }
00585     }
00586 
00587     return true;
00588 }
00589 
00594 bool parse_first_pass(Parser* parser)
00595 {
00596     char *save_ptr;
00597     char *line;
00598     char *program;
00599     char program_save[strlen(parser->program) + 1];
00600     strcpy(program_save, parser->program);
00601     
00602     parser->labels = NULL;
00603     parser->mem = NULL;
00604     parser->row = 1;
00605     parser->pc = 0;
00606     
00607     // read the buffer line by line
00608     for(program = program_save; ; parser->row++)
00609     {
00610         line = strtok_r(program, "\n\r", &save_ptr);
00611         if (line == NULL)
00612             break;
00613         program = NULL;
00614         
00615         char instr[256];
00616         
00617         parser->cur = line;
00618         parser->col = 1;
00619         
00620         // read the instructions name
00621         if(sscanf(parser->cur, "%s", instr) == 1)
00622         {
00623             int len = strlen(instr);
00624             if (instr[len - 1] == ':')
00625             {
00626                parser->labels = lbllist_add(parser->labels, parser->pc, instr,
00627                                             len - 1);
00628                // printf("added %s @ %.4X\n", instr, parser->pc);
00629             }
00630         }
00631 
00632         // we need to parse instructions, because we need to know the exact
00633         // addresse we are
00634         if(!parse_pass_line(parser, line))
00635         {
00636             fprintf(stderr, "parse_pass_line returned false\n");
00637             return false;
00638         }
00639     }
00640     
00641     parser->memsize = parser->pc;
00642     // allocate the memory correspind size needed to write the code
00643     parser->mem = malloc(parser->memsize * sizeof(parser->mem[0]));
00644     
00645     return true;
00646 }
00647 
00652 bool parse_second_pass(Parser* parser)
00653 {
00654     char *save_ptr;
00655     char *line;
00656     char *program;
00657     char program_save[strlen(parser->program) + 1];
00658     strcpy(program_save, parser->program);
00659     
00660     parser->row = 1;
00661     parser->pc = 0;
00662     
00663     // read the buffer line by line
00664     for(program = program_save; ; parser->row++)
00665     {
00666         line = strtok_r(program, "\n\r", &save_ptr);
00667         if (line == NULL)
00668             break;
00669         program = NULL;
00670 
00671         parser->cur = line;
00672         parser->col = 1;
00673         
00674         if (!parse_pass_line(parser, line))
00675         {
00676             fprintf(stderr, "parse_pass_line returned false\n");
00677             return false;
00678         }
00679     }
00680 
00681     return true;
00682 }
00683 
00684 bool sivm_parse(int* memsize, cmd_word *mem[], char *str)
00685 {
00686     Parser parser;
00687 
00688     parser.program = str;
00689     
00690     if(!parse_first_pass(&parser))
00691     {
00692         fprintf(stderr, "parse_first_pass returned false\n");
00693         return false;
00694     }
00695     
00696     if(!parse_second_pass(&parser))
00697     {
00698         fprintf(stderr, "parse_second_pass returned false\n");
00699         return false;
00700     }
00701 
00702     // 
00703     *memsize = parser.memsize;
00704     *mem = parser.mem;
00705 
00706     return true;
00707 }
